title: Google rolls out ‘preferred sources’ feature. How to add The Ionia Sentinel-Standard
description: Google's making it easier to see more of the sites you love, with the launch of this new feature. Here's what to know, including how to add The Sentinel-Standard to your "preferred sources."
content:
Want to see more of the sites you love? Google’s got you covered.

Earlier this month, the tech juggernaut launched “preferred sources,” a new feature that “lets you customize your experience to see more from your favorite sites within Top Stories.”

According to Google, “you can select your favorite sources and stay up to date on the latest content from the sites you follow and subscribe to — whether that’s your favorite sports blog or a local news outlet.”

Here’s how to add The Ionia Sentinel-Standard to your list of “preferred sources.”

The feature, launched on Aug. 12, allows you to curate or filter your news experience by source preference.

Any time you run a query or a keyword through the search engine using The Sentinel-Standard as your preferred source, you’ll see the latest content on that topic from The Sentinel-Standard. (The same goes for any other news site.)

According to Google, you can add or change your preferred sources anytime.

“When you select your preferred sources, you’ll start to see more of their articles prominently displayed within Top Stories when those sources have published fresh and relevant content for your search,” Google said.

How to add The Sentinel-Standard

Adding The Sentinel-Standard to your “preferred sources” is easy. You can either use this shortcut or follow these steps:
• Search for a topic that’s in the news and click on the icon to the right of “Top Stories”
• Search and select your “preferred sources" or your go-to news organizations
• Refresh your results and see more from your favorite sites

Other ways to keep up with The Sentinel-Standard
• Receive news alerts and updates from The Sentinel-Standard
• Sign up for newsletters on topics that matter most to you
• Plug in and stay connected with a subscription
summary: Google has launched "preferred sources" feature, a feature that allows users to filter their news experience by source preference. The feature was launched on Aug. 12 and allows for the latest content from The Ionia Sentinel-Standard. When users select their preferred sources, their articles will be prominently displayed within Top Stories. Additionally, users can receive news alerts and updates from The Sentinel-Server.
shortSummary: Google’s new “preferred sources” feature allows you to personalize and view preferred news articles, including The Sentinel-Standard, within Top Stories.
